function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The high level of air pollution is linked to the spread and impact of respiratory diseases, coronary heart diseases, lung cancer, and asthma, making people more susceptible to the damaging effects of contagious diseases such as coronavirus.","Impact":"Increased risk of respiratory diseases, coronary heart diseases, lung cancer, asthma, and greater susceptibility to contagious diseases like coronavirus.","Mitigation":"Reducing air pollution and improving air quality through decreased reliance on fossil fuel-based transportation systems and industrialization, and the adoption of cleaner energy sources.","Technologies":"Cleaner energy sources, electric vehicles, renewable energy technologies, and improved industrial emissions controls.","People":"Population exposed to air pollution and vulnerable to contagious diseases, particularly those in heavily industrialized and urbanized areas.","Owner":"Government, environmental agencies, urban planners, industrial corporations, and individuals."},{"Description":"Between 28,000 to 36,000 deaths per year in the UK are linked to long-term exposure to air pollutants, further increasing the impact of air pollution on public health and wellbeing.","Impact":"High number of deaths linked to long-term exposure to air pollutants, leading to adverse impacts on public health and wellbeing.","Mitigation":"Regulating industrial emissions, reducing reliance on fossil fuels, implementing clean air policies and regulations, and promoting public awareness of the health risks associated with air pollution.","Technologies":"Industrial emission controls, renewable energy technologies, electric vehicles, and public health education programs.","People":"Population in the UK exposed to long-term air pollution and at risk of associated health impacts.","Owner":"Government, environmental agencies, public health organizations, industrial corporations, and individuals."},{"Description":"Reduction in environmental noise over the lockdown period has been reported to have saved more lives than those already caused by COVID-19 in China, indicating the significant impact of environmental factors on public health.","Impact":"Reduction in environmental noise has contributed to saving lives and improving public health, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.","Mitigation":"Implementing measures to reduce environmental noise pollution, such as noise barriers, soundproofing, and urban planning strategies to minimize noise exposure.","Technologies":"Noise barriers, soundproofing materials, urban planning technologies, and noise pollution monitoring systems.","People":"Population exposed to environmental noise pollution, especially in urban areas and around transportation hubs.","Owner":"Urban planners, public health organizations, transportation authorities, and individuals."}]}
